comments:
3.0 RC 2

"Save As" wouldn't do as it should.

Having a file opened, I invoked "Save As". I then selected a different folder
where a file with the same name already existed. When I clicked "OK", it
correctly asked, "The file <destination> already exists. Do you want to replace
the existing file? (Yes/No/Cancel)". Clicking on "Yes" closes the "Save As" and
warning dialogs, but brings up the following error message dialog: "Save could
not be completed. Resource <destination> already exists. (OK)".

Perhaps the file (the one that already exists) was read only?  Was there 
anything in the .log file?

Nope, it's perfectly writable.

To make absolutely sure I've created two folders, both containing files with the
same name. I then opened one of the files and tried to "Save As" the other file.
Same behaviour.

As for the log file, there is no entry (at least not related to this problem).

In 3.0 RC 3, it gets even worse.

The first dialog appears asking me whether I want to overwrite the
already-existing resource. When clicking "Yes", the following error message appears:

--- snip ---
The command for the key you pressed failed

Reason:
Attempted to beginRule: F/makano/src/etc, does not match outer scope rule:
L/makano/src/etc/cactus.properties
--- snap ---

Please note that I opened a file in the project folder /makano/src/etc, and then
tried to "Save As" under the existing resource /makano/src/etc/cactus.properties

The error dialog has an "OK" button. When clicking it, the following exception
shows up in .metadata/.log:

--- snip ---
